>>          For one CMM Level 5 company
> 
> Is anyone else laughing at this?

What I found funny is the term "JUnit testing professional".

JUnit is targetted at developers (remember "_Programmers_ love writing 
tests"?) and not directly at QAs.  IMO a company should be looking for 
"software engineers with J2EE, Web Services, whatever ... and JUnit 
experiences" and not simply for "JUnit testing professionals".

But it seems to be a general trend: simply do a search on 
Dice/Monster/Hotjobs using the "JUnit" keyword: you will only find QA 
related positions (no offense meant).  It looks like the industry has 
not (yet) embraced the notion of "software engineers with [ your 
requirements here] and JUnit experiences".

Please correct me if I'm wrong.

-Vladimir
